N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 687.7 - Visitation, inspection and investigation of family care homes

State Regulations
(a) OPWDD shall
provide for the periodic visitation and inspection of each family care
home. (b) Inspections shall be made
as frequently as OPWDD may deem necessary, but in any event such inspections
shall be made on at least two occasions during each calendar year, one of which
shall be without prior notice. (c) OPWDD shall have the power to conduct investigations into the operations of any
person(s) or entity which holds an operating certificate issued by the
commissioner, into the operation of any family care home issued an operating
certificate by the commissioner, and into the operations related to the
provision of services regulated by this Part of any person(s) or entity
providing a family care home for individuals with intellectual and/or
developmental disabilities. OPWDD may designate a sponsoring agency to conduct
such investigations. (d) In
conducting an inspection or investigation, an authorized representative(s) of
OPWDD shall have the power to inspect the family care home, conduct interviews
with individuals, interview other persons residing in the family care home, examine and copy all records, including financial and medical records of the
family care home, and obtain such other information as may be required in order
to ensure compliance with all applicable requirements. (e) In conducting any inspection and
investigation under this Part, the commissioner is empowered to subpoena
witnesses, compel their attendance, administer oaths to witnesses, examine
witnesses under oath, and require the production of any books, papers or
records deemed relevant to the investigation, inspection or hearing. (f) Information obtained in the course of
such inspections and investigations shall be kept confidential. Notes
